TextBlock.Text: PLUME: To my beloved son; when you wake from your rest, I will likely have departed the tower to assist with transporting a new shipment of construction materials.
PLUME: Should another thunderstorm wake you, and keep you awake, perhaps writing may ease your restlessness: How has your short stay on this turbulent planet been thus far?
PLUME: I worry often about how you are adjusting to life here on this new planet.. Is your rest improving? Are you becoming more accustomed to the planet's greater mass?
PHLOX: Your concern touches me deeply, father. I rested.. well enough. B-but.. I thought I saw a terrifying sight above my resting place when I awoke in the dark.
PHLOX: It looked like a thorny tendril that had grown through the ceiling, coiling towards me in the dark.. And in a flash of lightning, it instantly vanished..
PHLOX: I do not miss Hollow's Lantern waking me to a wave of meteor impacts - but that was the last part of an equation! Perhaps I should travel to Ember Twin in search of a peaceful night of rest...
PLUME: A thorny tendril? Some roots of the trees in the Garden Chamber upstairs have indeed grown through the floor and into our chamber of respite.. But none I am aware of fit that description.

PLUME: But if what you observed is true, this <color=orange>unknown root</color> seems to be in a <color=orange>quantum superposition..</color> Could there be more quantum objects within this space than the quantum shard?
